title: Software Developer
name: Jesus Jimenez
description:
Hi there! I'm Jesus Jimenez. I'm an experienced software developer from Venezuela. I've been freelancing for 2 years and I'm dedicated to delivering high-quality work.

I specialize in full-stack web development and I'm well-versed in modern technologies. I'm passionate about software engineering and I'm particularly interested in Back-end web development, DevOps, data engineering, machine learning, and cybersecurity.

I'm flexible, and always eager to learn new technologies, and I'm confident that my skills and dedication will bring value to your team and contribute to the success of your project. Let's work together and make your project a success!
about:
My name is Jesus Jimenez, and I am a Software developer and freelancer based in Venezuela. I was born on September 22, 1998 and I am currently pursuing my Computer Engineering degree at the "Universidad Nacional Experimental del Tachira (UNET)" in San Cristobal, Venezuela. In February 2023, I will be starting my Master's degree in Big Data at the IMF Academy in Madrid, Spain.

I have a passion for software engineering, and all-things programming. At the age of 9 I hosted my own Habbo Hotel Retro server on a blog, that was my very first experience with programming. Since then I'm a geek.

I am also an avid fan of Progressive Rock/Metal music, my favorite bands include Opeth, Soen, Karnivool, Tool, and Leprous. I'm not a game but I do spent more time than what I would like in video games like League of Legends, Dota 2, and Magic The Gathering.

projects.title: ZippyMeals
projects.position: Software developer | Full-stack web developer | Android Developer
projects.description: ZippyMeals is a web application that offers cloud solutions to the Meals On Wheels organizations in the United States and Canada. Worked as Full-stack web developer in multiple features for the website with Vue.js in the front-end and Django and PostgreSQL in the back-end. Also, I developed their Android application with Kotlin, MVVM, dagger, and Android Room for the SQL database management.
projects.feedback:
Jesus has completed several large development tasks for my company, with minimal supervision and minimal direction. He sticks with tasks until completion, is pleasant to work with, and has had the ability to learn every new technology I have thrown at him. Highly recommended.

He built two mobile apps from scratch for my company, helped me handle customer support, and fixed bugs on my web application. He asks pertinent questions when he needs to, and has willingly and enthusiastically learned how my particular system works. I communicate with him over Slack, which has worked really well, as he is responsive.

I don't offer much in terms of guidance or direction, so his ability to be a self-starter and figure things out on his own has been fantastic.

projects.title: Guidepost
projects.position: Full-stack web developer | Back-end web developer | Database architect
projects.description: Developed the MVP's first stage of the API and front-end for the Guidepost project, a web application that offers a platform for people to explore and take on new adventures. The API was developed with Django REST Framework and PostgreSQL as the RDBM. Next.js for the front-end and JWT for authentication.

projects.title: MusicAsCode
projects.description: The goal was to implement a digital audio workstation-like interface using React, ToneJs, and TwoJs. I contributed to the project by building 2D figures with audio capabilities using an OOP javascript-oriented paradigm that implements features inside the classes and controllers for the libraries, also implementing the javascript features within React components.

projects.title: Stripe integration with Vue and Firebase
projects.description: I contributed into this project by implementing dashboard view, stripe integration with firebase functions and subscription payments, handling subscriptions actions, setting credits on subscription taken, custom firestore database triggers, and handle of the main action taken with the credits.
